newsitem.title: RUSSIA: SWIMMING-POPOV READY TO TRAIN AFTER KNIFE ATTACK.
newsitem.headline: SWIMMING-POPOV READY TO TRAIN AFTER KNIFE ATTACK.

text.p: Doctors have told double Olympic gold medallist Alexander Popov he can get back in the pool and start training after being knifed on a Moscow street in August, Itar-Tass news agency said on Thursday.
The swimmer had a check up in a Moscow clinic and can start training when he returns on Sunday to Australia, his home for nearly four years.
At the Atlanta Olympics, Popov became the first man to retain the 100 and 50 metres freestyle titles.
He was stabbed in the stomach during an argument with a Moscow water melon seller and underwent two hours of delicate surgery.
